ngiemboon: N kwǎŋ ngie n dɔɔn ńgɔɔn yɔ́ɔn nò mbwó pi páʼ nyìŋ gẅie à pʉ̌a la, mbà pi ge zẅíŋ, pi ké ńcʉ́ʼ n gɔɔn na yɛ̌ ntí.
en: I wish you would put up with a little foolishness   from me. Yes, do put up with me!  # 11:1 Or Yes, you are putting up with me

ngiemboon: Pi zsé ngie n kwoŋo gẅí tà n te zẅíŋ ngie nyìŋ gwaa gÿo mmó na pi n ne ńgyá wɔ́. Yɛ̌ ntí nkwòŋe gie n gẅiin nzèm pi e fóo pɔ́ mbwó Ssé, mélàʼmie pi ée mbwó mèŋ, ńgwɔ́ páʼ múɔngùɔ gẅie à nyě te zsě mámbàŋa, á múɔngùɔ gẅie n da pÿé mbwó tàʼ nyìŋ wémɔʼɔ́, angàŋ gwɔ́ Keleto. N ne ńdaʼte gẅí mbwó yé ngie pi ee páʼ múɔngùɔ gẅie à nyě te zsé mámbàŋa mba à kaa tsɔ́ ncÿǒ kaa.
en: For I am jealous   for you with a godly jealousy,  # 11:2 Nm 25:13; Gl 4:17 because I have promised you in marriage to one husband #— #to present a pure  # 11:2 Php 4:8 virgin to Christ.

ngiemboon: Táʼ, n kě ḿbɔ́gɔ pɔ́ ngie, à lɔɔn ngwɔ́ tsɔ̌ nyìŋ cʉŋte twó gí páʼ nnú la páʼ legye, éfʉte Évà, pi le gíŋ ńgwɔ́ pʉ̀a pie é gwaa gɔɔn ngie pɔ́ zsé yɔ́b pɔ́ ndàʼ nò Keleto, ńgɔɔn éshwóŋo nò wɔ́.
en: But I fear that, as the serpent   deceived  # 11:3 Rm 7:11; 16:18; 1Co 3:18; 2Th 2:3; 1Tm 2:14 Eve  # 11:3 Gn 3:20 by his cunning, your minds may be seduced from a sincere and pure  # 11:3 Other mss omit and pure devotion to Christ.  # 11:3 1Th 3:5

ngiemboon: N gɔɔn páʼɔɔn nue n ne ńgyá ngie nyìŋ léen ńgwɔ́ tà ńtó, éshwóŋo gẅí nò na tsɔ̌ Yěsô, á ké te gẅie peg la gɔɔn nò na yé wɔ́, pi gwóon ńzẅíŋ, ńgíŋ ńne ńgyá, nyìŋ tóo ńgɔɔn nò ndyɛ̀ʼɛ na Zẅìge Ndʉalʉ̌a, kà pɔ́ na nkʉ̀ mbòŋo wɔ́ɔ, á ké te pumte na menò mie pi la vɔg ńzẅíŋ wɔ́, pi zẅíŋ zẅǐŋ.
en: For if a person comes and preaches another Jesus,   whom we did not preach, or you receive a different spirit,  # 11:4 1Jn 4:1 which you had not received, or a different gospel,  # 11:4 Gl 1:6 which you had not accepted, you put up with it splendidly!

ngiemboon: Tá n ne ńkwaŋa yɔ́ɔn ngie pʉ̀a pie pi gyá ngie pɔ́ ée memǎa megàŋntúm Yěsô lɛ̂, pɔ́ té cʉa wɔ́ɔn na tsɔ́ mmó wɔ́.
en: Now I consider myself in no way inferior to those “super-apostles.”

ngiemboon: Ndyɛ̀ʼ áa nò ngie m bubte pubte táʼ, ńgʉa na lezsé nò Ssé, atsɔ́ lɔ̌ʼ té kẅɛ. Peg léen ńnyɛɛ wɛ̌ legwɔ́ mbwó pi na mentí tà ńgyɔ́ɔn é ngwòŋ fʉ̀ʼ ntsèm gẅie á la ná shÿó.
en: Even if I am untrained in public speaking,   I am certainly not untrained in knowledge.  # 11:6 Php 3:8; 1Jn 4:8 Indeed, we have in every way made that clear to you in everything.

ngiemboon: N da gwaa tsẅi nkʉ̀ mbòŋo nò Ssé mbwó pi, ńtsẅi pɔ́ sẅɛ̀ɛ sẅɛ̀ɛ. Ésẅíʼi mbùm yɔ̀ɔn ńnáa ssé, lélɔg ńkaʼa pwó gí ńnáa tÿǒ péʼe á lɔgɔ ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ tsɔ́ lɔ̌ʼ keen?
en: Or did I commit a sin by humbling   myself so that you might be exalted,  # 11:7 Lk 1:52 because I preached the gospel of God to you free of charge?  # 11:7 Ac 18:3

ngiemboon: N da ne faʼa láʼ pi, ńzẅíŋ metsɔ́ mecúʼtè pʉ̀a Keleto zɔ̌ ne ńnáa nkáb né mèŋ, ńdɔgɔ ńtóonte wɔ́ɔn tà ngwɔ́ mé gɔɔn ngie n da gÿo pɔ́ fÿɔg.
en: I robbed other churches by taking pay from them to minister to you.

ngiemboon: N daa láʼ pi, á gwɔ́ fʉ̀ʼʉ n zága mmó, n te kẅé mmó mbwó tsɔ̌ nyìŋ gẅi wɔ́. Mefɛ̌ mefɛ̌ pie é la fó Masenduwane la náa kɔ̀ɔkɔ́ɔ gie á la ne ńzága mbwó mèŋ. Á la gʉa na kɔ̀ɔkɔ́ɔ, n te zẅíŋe légwɔ́ pìʼ á mbwó tsɔ̌ nyìŋ gẅi wɔ́, é ké le láʼa tsɔ́ lyɛ̌ʼ tá ńgwɔ́ pìʼ mbwó tsɔ̌ nyìŋ gẅi wɔ́.
en: When I was present with you and in need, I did not burden anyone, since the brothers who came from Macedonia   supplied my needs.  # 11:9 Php 4:10 I have kept myself, and will keep myself, from burdening you in any way.

ngiemboon: N ge fó na nò nénʉ́ Keleto gie áa tsɛ̀ɛ ntʉ́m mèŋ, é gɔɔn mbwó pi ngie, n dɔɔn ńgʉa pɔ́ nzɔ̌ jʉʼ á tsɛ̀ɛ Akaye wɔ́ɔ, ń de gwáʼa wɛ̌ legwɔ́ gẅie n dɔg ńkaʼte wɔ́. N te láʼa tsɔ́ lyɛ̌ʼ, é kẅé mmó mbwó nyìŋ gẅi wɔ́.
en: As the truth of Christ is in me, this boasting of mine will not be stopped   in the regions of Achaia.  # 11:10 Ac 18:12

ngiemboon: N gɔɔn púʼu, mélàʼakɔ́? Áa nue n te gẅí kwoŋ keen? Ngǎŋ, e Ssé ne ńzsé ngie n kwoŋo gẅí.
en: Why? Because I don’t love you? God knows I do!

ngiemboon: Áa mmó gie n ne ńgÿo, n ge gíŋ kẅiʼi gÿo pɔ́ púʼu, é lɔg gʉa né mvfò, ńzsé ngie n ge lɔg záʼ mekwò pʉ̀a pie é ne faʼa ndilétaŋ lélɔg ńkaʼte ńgɔɔn ngie peg lâ pɔ̌ pǔ faʼa pɔ́ tàʼ ntí.
en: But I will continue to do what I am doing, in order to deny   an opportunity to those who want to be regarded as our equals in what they boast about.

ngiemboon: Epʉ̀a apɛ̌ ée megàŋntúm pe tepòŋ, pɔ́ cÿɔ nò ngie pɔ́ faʼa fàʼa Keleto. Mbà pɔ́ léen ńgÿo tà ngwɔ́ gie mé lɔɔn ńgyá wɔ́b, mé gɔɔn ngie ée megàŋntúm Yěsô.
en: For such people are false apostles,   deceitful workers, disguising themselves as apostles of Christ.

ngiemboon: Á té púʼu, ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ tsɔ́ nò mɔɔnmɔɔn wɔ́, á nue Sátà gǐŋ ńnéŋe yé tà sele ńcʉ́ʼ ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ páʼ Cÿɔ́ʼ Ssé gẅie à fóo jʉʼ gie kyɛ̀ʼ áa wó la.
en: And no wonder! For Satan disguises himself as an angel of light.

ngiemboon: Pi lɔgɔ ńgyá ngie, á té tʉʉ mbwó pafaʼa fàʼa Sátà lésele tà mé cʉ́ʼ ńgyá wɔ́b ńgɔɔn pɔ́ ngie pɔ́ ée pafaʼa fàʼa Ssé wɔ́. Táʼ, á ge ké láʼ cʉ́ʼʉ nzsòte, pɔ́ kẅé ntsɔʼɔ́fàʼ e gwɔ́ pɔ́ páʼ mefàʼ mɔ́b gwɔ́.
en: So it is no great surprise if his servants also disguise themselves as servants of righteousness. Their end will be according to their works.

ngiemboon: Tà mèŋ n gíŋ shwóŋo gẅí, ḿbɔ́ɔn nyìŋ gẅi lékwaŋ ngie n gee pʉ̀a, ńkwoŋ pi kwaŋ, ńzẅíŋ ngie n gÿo páʼ pʉ̀a la, n zẅɛ́ʼ yɔ́ɔn ńnáʼa ńkaʼte méjʉʼ.
en: I repeat: Let no one consider me a fool. But if you do, at least accept me as a fool so that I can also boast a little.

ngiemboon: Páʼ á gwɔ̌ légwɔ́ gie n ge kaʼte la, ammó gie n gee ngɔ̌ɔn fʉ̀ʼɔɔn, n těen ńge gɔɔn na ntí gie Cʉ̀apʉ̀a ne ńkwoŋo wɔ́. N ge gɔɔn pɔ́ páʼ fʉ̀ʼ gie n kwǎʼ ḿbʉ́a la.
en: What I am saying in this matter   of boasting, I don’t speak as the Lord would, but as it were, foolishly.

ngiemboon: Epʉ̀a tà ńgyɔ́ɔn ne ńdɔgɔ pɔ́ shúm sie é gwɔ́ pɔ́ se pʉ̀a mesoŋ ńkaʼte, púʼu la, n ge kaʼte yɔ́ɔn.
en: Since many boast according to the flesh, I will also boast.

ngiemboon: Pi ne ńkwaŋa ngie legye sí ée wó, tá á ké yɛ̂ gie pi zẅiŋé nò mepʉ̀a lɛ̂!
en: For you, being so wise, gladly put up with fools!

ngiemboon: Epʉ̀a ne ńdɔgɔ gẅí ńgÿo menkwɔɔn pɔ́b, pi faʼa, pɔ́ jÿó, pɔ́ ne ńjʉʉ shúm sí, ńne ńnẅile gẅí, ńtúu pwó legɔ̀ʼ pi, pi zẅíŋe zẅǐŋ.
en: In fact, you put up with it if someone enslaves you, if someone exploits   you, if someone takes advantage of you, if someone is arrogant toward you, if someone slaps  # 11:20 Mt 5:39 you in the face.

ngiemboon: Eshʉ́ kwàʼ ne ńkúu wɔ́ɔn páʼ n da te gẅiin shÿɔ̀gɔ ntʉ́m lényɛɛ gẅí nò páʼ pɔ́b wɔ́.
en: I say this to our shame: We have been too weak for that!

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ lɔgɔ pɔ́ páʼ pɔ́ ée pʉ̀a Ébɛ̀ ńkaʼte keen? Mbɔɔ mèŋ yɔ́ɔn n gwɔ́ pɔ́ tsɔ̌. Kà pɔ́ páʼ pɔ́ ée pʉ̀a Ésàlayɛ? Mbà n tyě páʼɔɔn ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ tsɔ̌. Kà pɔ́ páʼ pɔ́ ée pʉ̀a na ngẅɛ̀ Ábalaham? Mbɔɔ mèŋ yɔ́ɔn n gwɔ̌ pɔ́ tsɔ̌.
en: Are they Hebrews?   So am I. Are they Israelites? So am I. Are they the descendants of Abraham?  # 11:22 Gn 16:15; Gl 3:29 So am I.

ngiemboon: Kà pɔ́ páʼ pɔ́ ée pafaʼa fàʼa Keleto? Mbà n ge gɔɔn nò kwàʼ páʼ pʉ̀a la, é gɔɔn ngie n gee nyìŋ gẅie à faʼa fàʼa Keleto tà ńtɔ́gɔ wɔ́b metsèm, é gɔɔn púʼu, éfóo na páʼ n dǎ téŋe zìʼi ńcʉa wɔ́b, éfóo na nzẅìŋ gẅie n dǎ kúu tsǎŋ ńcʉa wɔ́b, éfóo na nzẅìŋ gẅie mé lǎ cúɔ wɔ́ɔn ńcʉa wɔ́b, éfóo na nzẅìŋ mengʉ̀a tà ńgyɔ́ɔn mie legwé la nÿɔgɔ wɔ́ɔn ńcʉa wɔ́b,
en: Are they servants of Christ? I’m talking like a madman #— #I’m a better one: with far more labors, many more imprisonments, far worse beatings, many times near death.

ngiemboon: ée ngʉ̀a ntʉ̂a páʼ pà Yúndà cǔɔ wɔ́ɔn mengwɔɔn ntsɔ̀b lepfwɔʼɔ́ né móm tá,
en: Five times I received the forty lashes minus one from the Jews.

ngiemboon: ée ngʉ̀a ntá páʼ pà Loma lǎ lɔgɔ tsemé mmó ńcúɔ wɔ́ɔn, mé la lɔg metǒon ńtémte wɔ́ɔn tàʼ legʉ̀a, éfaʼa lézẅé wɔ́ɔn, ée ngʉ̀a ntá páʼ á lǎ cʉ́ʼʉ méjʉʼ, lánzì lɔgɔ wɔ́ɔn fÿɛ́ɛ ntse. N dǎ cʉ́ŋe na kème nkẅíŋ ndùm zème ntse, ńdáʼa mǒ tà ńgíŋ ńzɔ́g.
en: Three times I was beaten with rods.   Once I received a stoning.  # 11:25 Ac 14:19 Three times I was shipwrecked.  # 11:25 Ac 27:1–44; 1Tm 1:19 I have spent a night and a day in the open sea.

ngiemboon: N dǎ giŋ tɛʼ, legwé nÿɔgɔ wɔ́ɔn tɛʼ, n gwá ńgyá ngɔ́ʼ mentse mie é kwɔ̌ʼ tà sa jʉʼ, ńgwá ńgwe na mbwó mesèmncwò, ńgwá ńgwe na mbwó mefɛ̌ pɔ́ɔn pà Yúndà, ńgwá ńgwe na mbwó pʉ̀a pie é té pà Yúndà wɔ́, ńgwá ńkúu nò tsɛ̀ɛ metÿǒsoŋ, ńgwá ńkúu nò kwòŋotsẅɛ, ńgwá ńkúu nò tsɛ̀ɛ ntse tépàa, ńgwá ńkúu nò mbwó pʉ̀a pie é cÿɔ nò ngie pɔ́ ée pʉ̀a Keleto,
en: On frequent journeys, I faced dangers from rivers, dangers from robbers,   dangers from my own people,  # 11:26 Ac 9:23; 13:50; 14:5; 17:5; 18:12; 20:3,19; 21:27; 23:10–12; 25:3 dangers from Gentiles, dangers in the city, dangers in the wilderness, dangers at sea, and dangers among false brothers;

ngiemboon: ńgwá faʼ mefàʼ mie é tʉ̀ tà ńjúʼ ńkʉ́a tɛʼ, ńgwá ńdáʼ té lyé. Nzyè gwá ńgyáŋa wɔ́ɔn, agág yɔ́ɔn gwá shÿó, ńgwɔ́ tsɔ́ fʉ̀ʼ, eshúm léjÿó pú ḿmaga mbwó mèŋ, efÿɔ́g gwá ńkúu wɔ́ɔn, mbà n zǎg nzsǒ.
en: toil and hardship, many sleepless nights, hunger and thirst, often without food, cold, and without clothing.

ngiemboon: N kaa tʉ́ ntsèm wɔ́, áa lyɛ̌ʼ ntsèm n ne sáŋa nò na mecúʼtè pʉ̀a Keleto mie ée jʉʼ ntsèm,
en: Not to mention   other things, there is the daily pressure on me: my concern for all the churches.

ngiemboon: ńgwɔ́ gie nyìŋ Keleto lɔɔn ḿbÿɛ́, n júʼ á gwɔ́ pɔ́ páʼ fʉ̀ʼ gie m bÿɛ̌ yɔ́ɔn ma, ńgwɔ́ gie nyìŋ Keleto lɔɔn ńgÿo nò tepòŋ, á gege wɔ́ɔn tɛʼ.
en: Who is weak, and I am not weak? Who is made to stumble,   and I do not burn with indignation?

ngiemboon: Á gwéʼe péʼe ńne ńzɛ́te ngie mè kaʼte, mbà ngwɔ́ n dɔg pɔ́ páʼ m bÿɛ pÿɛ̌ ńkaʼte.
en: If boasting is necessary, I will boast about my weaknesses.

ngiemboon: E Ssé gie ee tá pà Ndè wege Yěsô Keleto, yé Ssé gie e ne ńzɛ́te ngie mé guʼte yé té záʼa pàa, à ne ńzsé ngie n těen ńgɔɔn páʼɔɔn ńdɔgɔ ńcÿɔɔ nò wɔ́.
en: The God and Father   of the Lord Jesus, who is blessed forever, knows I am not lying.

ngiemboon: Á laa fʉ̀ʼʉ gie n daa tÿǒsoŋo Ndamásè, ngúmnɔ̀ɔn gẅie fùɔ Aletásè la zába yé, á tsẅi mé ne ḿbyɛ́bɛ mencwò nkáʼa tÿǒsoŋ, éfaʼa légwoon wɔ́ɔn.
en: In Damascus,   a ruler  # 11:32 Gk ethnarches; a leader of an ethnic community under King Aretas guarded the city of Damascus in order to arrest me.

ngiemboon: Tá mé néŋe wɔ́ɔn tsɛ̀ɛ kèkàg, éfó na tsɔ́ tɔ̀gɔnkyɛʼ gie áa na nkáʼ ńtsege wɔ́ɔn, ésẅíʼi wɔ́ɔn ńtÿɔ́gɔ ssé, tá n tsẅɛ́ɛ yé.
en: So I was let down in a basket through a window in the wall and escaped from his hands.
